[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Constants: TRANSACTION_SUMMARIES_BY_ACCOUNT_CF_NAME] [Summary consistency] Are transaction summaries (TRANSACTION_SUMMARIES_BY_ACCOUNT_CF_NAME) kept consistent with full transactions (TRANSACTION_CF_NAME), or can divergence cause API queries to return incorrect results? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Constants: TRANSACTION_INFO_CF_NAME] [Info validation] Does TRANSACTION_INFO_CF_NAME properly validate gas used, state root changes, and event counts against actual transaction execution, preventing false transaction metadata? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Constants: TRANSACTION_AUXILIARY_DATA_CF_NAME] [Auxiliary data injection] Can malicious auxiliary data be injected into TRANSACTION_AUXILIARY_DATA_CF_NAME to manipulate transaction processing or fee calculation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Function: ensure_slice_len_eq() + ensure_slice_len_gt()] [Concurrent validation] If multiple threads call these validation functions simultaneously on overlapping data ranges, can race conditions cause incorrect validation results? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Schema modules] [Concurrent schema access] When multiple transactions write to the same column families concurrently, are there proper locking mechanisms to prevent torn reads/writes? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Constants: STATE_VALUE_CF_NAME] [State read-write races] Can concurrent reads from STATE_VALUE_CF_NAME during writes cause validators to see inconsistent state, leading to consensus disagreements? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Constants: Event schemas] [Event ordering races] With multiple event-related column families, can concurrent event writes cause events to be stored with incorrect sequence numbers or timestamps? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Function: ensure_slice_len_eq()] [Error propagation] If ensure_slice_len_eq returns an error, are calling functions handling it correctly, or can ignored errors allow malformed data to propagate through the system? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Function: ensure_slice_len_gt()] [Partial failure handling] If ensure_slice_len_gt fails midway through a batch operation, is there proper rollback, or can partial writes corrupt database state? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Schema modules] [Decode error recovery] When schema decode operations fail (e.g., in decode_key or decode_value), can validators recover gracefully or do they crash, causing network instability? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Constants: All CFs] [RocksDB error handling] If RocksDB operations on any column family fail (disk full, I/O error), is there proper error propagation to prevent silent data loss? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Schema modules] [Key collision] Do different schemas use sufficiently unique key encoding schemes to prevent accidental collisions if data is written to wrong column families? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Constants: STATE_VALUE_BY_KEY_HASH_CF_NAME + HOT_STATE_VALUE_BY_KEY_HASH_CF_NAME] [Hash collision] Are state key hashes using cryptographically secure hash functions, or can hash collisions allow attackers to overwrite arbitrary state values? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Schema modules] [Version encoding] Do schemas that use version as part of the key (like StateValueSchema with inverted version) handle version wrap-around correctly, or can overflow cause key collisions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Constants: TRANSACTION_BY_HASH_CF_NAME] [Transaction hash collision] If two transactions produce the same hash (birthday attack), can this cause transaction data corruption or loss? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Constants: All CFs] [Unbounded growth] Are there size limits on data stored in each column family, or can attackers fill storage with massive transactions/events causing disk exhaustion? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Constants: EVENT_CF_NAME] [Event spam] Can malicious contracts emit unlimited events filling EVENT_CF_NAME and related indexes, causing storage DOS? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Constants: STALE_NODE_INDEX_CF_NAME] [Stale index growth] If stale nodes aren't pruned efficiently, can STALE_NODE_INDEX_CF_NAME grow unbounded causing performance degradation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Function: ensure_slice_len_gt()] [Large slice DoS] Can extremely large len parameters to ensure_slice_len_gt cause integer overflow in subsequent size calculations leading to buffer overflows? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Schema modules] [Backward compatibility] If schema encoding formats change, is there proper version tracking to ensure old data can still be decoded, or can migrations corrupt historical data? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Constants: DB_METADATA_CF_NAME] [Schema version tracking] Does DB_METADATA_CF_NAME track schema versions for all column families, and is this checked on startup to prevent version mismatches? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Schema modules] [Online migration] Can schema migrations happen while validators are running, and if so, are there atomic switchover mechanisms to prevent reading partially-migrated data? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Constants: Line 38-69] [Column family deletion] If a deprecated schema's column family is removed, is there validation to prevent accidental attempts to access it causing crashes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Constants: TRANSACTION_INFO_CF_NAME + TRANSACTION_CF_NAME] [Referential integrity] Is referential integrity enforced between TRANSACTION_INFO_CF_NAME and TRANSACTION_CF_NAME, or can orphaned transaction info exist without corresponding transactions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/aptosdb/src/schema/mod.rs] [Constants: JELLYFISH_MERKLE_NODE_CF_NAME + STATE_VALUE_CF_NAME] [State-Merkle consistency] Are state values and their Merkle tree nodes kept consistent, or can state updates fail to update the Merkle tree causing proof generation failures? (Critical)
